info.title: Spatial Separation Between Buildings
info.subtitle: Volume II - 9.10.14.1-4
info.description: Calculations for size/number of doors/windows in a wall facing another building

P01.questionText: Does the Building Code apply to this structure?

P02.questionText: Check all that apply to the structure in this project.

possibleAnswers.answerDisplayText: This project will involve the construction or design of a new <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will result in a change in <defined-term>occupancy</defined-term>.
The project will result in an <defined-term>alteration</defined-term> to an existing <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will result in an addition to an existing <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will result in the demolition of an existing <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will consist of the repair of a <defined-term>building</defined-term> that has been damaged by fire, earthquake, or other causes of damage.
The project will correct unsafe conditions in or about a <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will involve changes that will affect the <defined-term override-term='occupancy'>occupied</defined-term> parts of the <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will involve work necessary to ensure safety in the remaining parts of a <defined-term>building</defined-term> after demolition.
The project will involve work necessary to ensure safety in parts affected but not directly involved in an <defined-term>alteration</defined-term> to the <defined-term>building</defined-term>.
The project will involve work necessary to ensure safety in parts affected but not directly involved in an addition to the <defined-term>building</defined-term>.

The project will involve the installation, replacement, or <defined-term>alteration</defined-term> of materials or equipment regulated by this Code (except as permitted by the British Columbia Fire Code).
This project will involve the work necessary to ensure safety in a relocated <defined-term>building</defined-term> during and after the relocation.
This project will affect safety during construction of a <defined-term>building</defined-term>, including protection of the public.
This project will involve the design, installation, extension, <defined-term>alteration</defined-term>, renewal or repair of plumbing systems.

This project will involve the <defined-term>alteration</defined-term>, rehabilitation and change of <defined-term>occupancy</defined-term> of <defined-term override-term='heritage building'>heritage buildings</defined-term>.

possibleInvalidAnswers.errorMessage: 'None of the above' cannot be selected at the same time as other answers

P03.questionText: Check all that apply to this project.

possibleAnswers.answerDisplayText: This project consists of sewage, water, electrical, telephone, rail or similar public infrastructure systems located in a <defined-term>street</defined-term> or a public transit right of way.

This project consists of utility towers and poles, and television, radio and other communication aerials and towers, except for loads resulting from their being located on or attached to <defined-term override-term='building'>buildings</defined-term>.
This project consists of mechanical or other equipment and appliances not specifically regulated in these regulations.
This project consists of flood control and hydro electric dams and structures.
This project consists of accessory buildings less than 10 m<sup>2</sup> in <defined-term>building area</defined-term> that do not create a hazard.

This project has permission of the <defined-term  override-term='authority having jurisdiction'>authorities having jurisdiction</defined-term> to provide construction site offices, seasonal storage buildings, special events facilities, emergency facilities, and/or similar structures.

This project consists of Factory-built housing and components complying with CSA-Z240 MH Series standard, but this exemption does not extend to on site preparations (siting, foundations, mountings), connection to services and installation of appliances.

possibleInvalidAnswers.errorMessage: 'None of the above' cannot be selected at the same time as other answers

P05.questionText: Does this project involve the <defined-term>alteration</defined-term> of an existing <defined-term>building</defined-term>?

P06.questionText: Which <defined-term override-term='major occupancy'>major occupancies</defined-term> will be included in this <defined-term>building</defined-term>?

P07.questionText: Is the <defined-term>building area</defined-term> of this <defined-term>building</defined-term> greater than 600 m<sup>2</sup>?

P08.questionText: How many <defined-term override-term='storey'>storeys</defined-term> in <defined-term>building height</defined-term> will this building be?

P1.questionText: What are the <defined-term override-term='major occupancy'>major occupancies</defined-term> of this building?

P2.questionText: Would this building be required to meet Subsection 9.10.15. per <pdf-download-link number='910151' named-dest='9.10.15.1. Application'>Article 9.10.15.1.</pdf-download-link>?

P3.questionText: Does this building conform to <pdf-download-link number='93511' named-dest='9.35.1.1. Application'>Article 9.35.1.1.</pdf-download-link>?

P4.questionText: Is this building a detached garage or accessory building that meets all of the following requirements:
P4.questionSubtext:
• Faces a dwelling unit.
  • Serves only one dwelling unit.
  • Is located on the same property as that dwelling unit.
  • The dwelling unit is the only major occupancy on the property.

P5.questionText: What is the area of the exposing building face of this fire compartment (m2)?
P5.questionSubtext:
The area of an exposing building face is calculated by taking the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, calculate the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min. Sentence 9.10.14.2.(1)

If a building is divided by fire separations into fire compartments, the area of the exposing building face is permitted to be calculated for each fire compartment, provided the fire separations have a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min. Sentence 9.10.14.2.(4)

P6.questionText: What is the limiting distance for the exterior wall for this fire compartment (m)?
P6.questionSubtext: The location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).

P7.questionText: Is this compartment <defined-term>sprinklered</defined-term> per <pdf-download-link named-dest='3.2.5.12. Automatic Sprinkler Systems'>Article 3.2.5.12.</pdf-download-link>?

P8.questionText: Does the time from receipt of notification of a fire by the fire department until the first fire department vehicle arrives at the <defined-term>building</defined-term> exceed 10 min in 10% or more of all calls to this <defined-term>building</defined-term>?

P11.questionText: Is this building a <defined-term>storage garage</defined-term> with all <defined-term override-term='storey'>storeys</defined-term> constructed as <defined-term override-term='open-air storey'>open-air storeys</defined-term>?

P12.questionText: Does this <defined-term>fire compartment</defined-term> face a <defined-term>street</defined-term> and is at <defined-term>street</defined-term> level?

P13.questionText: Will all the unprotected openings be glazed with one of the following?
P13.questionSubtext:
• wired glass in steel frames, as described in Article 9.10.13.5.
  • glass blocks, as described in Article 9.10.13.7.

R00.resultDisplayMessage: You have selected an answer that indicates that the BC Building Code 2024 does not apply to this structure. This tool is used to assist building code users in determining the applicable requirements for their building, as such all structures that are not governed by the BC Building Code 2024 are beyond the scope of this tool.

R01.resultDisplayMessage:
You have selected:

This indicates that some or all of this structure may not be governed by the BC Building Code 2024. This tool has been designed to assist BC Building Code 2024 users in determining the Building Code requirements for Part 9 buildings. Based on your selection, some or all of your project is beyond the scope of this tool at this time.

R02.resultDisplayMessage: You have selected an option that indicates that this building is a heritage building. Heritage buildings have alternative measures for Building Code compliance. These alternative measures are beyond the scope of this tool at this time. Please see in Table 1.1.1.1.(5) of Division A - Section 1.1 General for more information.

R03.resultDisplayMessage: You have selected an option that indicates that this building is an alteration to an existing building. Alteration to existing buildings have alternative measures for Building Code compliance. These alternative measures are beyond the scope of this tool at this time. Please see Sentences 1.1.1.1(6) and 1.1.1.2.(1), and Table 1.1.1.1.(6) in Division A - Section 1.1 General for more information.

R05.resultDisplayMessage: Based on the options you have selected; this project is not a Part 9 building. This tool is designed to assist BC Building Code 2024 users in evaluating Part 9 buildings for conformance with Division B Acceptable Solutions of the BC Building Code, therefore your project is beyond the scope of this tool at this time.

R10.resultDisplayMessage: Openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2m are required to be protected by closures, other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall. (See Table 9.10.13.1.)

R20.resultDisplayMessage:
Based on Table 9.10.14.4.-A and Sentence 9.10.14.4.(1) the maximum percentage of unprotected openings in this exterior wall is %, based on an exposing building face of m2, the maximum area would be m2.

The maximum size of openable windows having an unobstructed opening equal to or greater than 0.35 m2 installed in accordance with Sentences 9.9.10.1.(1) and (2) is: m2.

A single room or space shall mean:

  • two or more adjacent spaces having a full-height separating wall extending less than 1.5 m from the interior face of the exterior wall, or
  • two or more stacked spaces that are on the same storey.

The spacing between individual unprotected openings described that serve a single room or space shall be not less than:

  • 2 m horizontally of another unprotected opening that is on the same exposing building face and serves the single room or space, or
  • 2 m vertically of another unprotected opening that serves the single room or space, or another room or space on the same storey.

*Note: Per Clause 9.10.14.4.(1)(b) the percentage of unprotected openings is permitted to be calculated in conformance with Subsection 3.2.3. At this time Subsection 3.2.3 is beyond the scope of this tool.

R30.resultDisplayMessage:
The maximum percentage of unprotected openings in this exterior wall is %, based on an exposing building face of m2, the maximum area would be: m2.

*Note: Per Clause 9.10.14.4.(1)(b) the percentage of unprotected openings is permitted to be calculated in conformance with Subsection 3.2.3. At this time Subsection 3.2.3 is beyond the scope of this tool.

R40.resultDisplayMessage: Based on your selections and Article 9.10.14.4., this fire compartment is permitted to have unlimited unprotected openings.

R50.resultDisplayMessage: Subsection 9.10.14 does not apply to detached carports conforming to Section 9.35. that serve not more than one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite.

R51.resultDisplayMessage: Based on your selection the percentage and area of unprotected openings should be calculated based on Subsection 9.10.15. At this time this tool does not calculate the percentage and area of unprotected openings of houses that meet the requirements of Subsection 9.10.15.
